title: "Face enrolment didn't work." Face Unlock malfunctioning on new Pixel 4, can't configure.
content:
My new Pixel 4 arrived last night, so I started setting it up, transferring things over from my Pixel 2, etc etc.
I got through the Face Unlock setup, where everything behaved pretty well, and it was all smooth and quick and nice.. until this morning.
The face verification just completely stopped working.
I noticed it first with 1Password, but everything else on the phone that used it stopped working too.
Given that I was setting up lots of things, and logging in to all sorts of apps, websites, etc, I was using the biometric unlock feature in the 1Password app a lot and probably doing the face unlock dozens of times per minute as I bounced between 1Password and other things.
Next, I tried to delete the face data in Settings > Security and go for a clean slate, but after I pressed the "delete face data" button, it popped up the little rounded notification at bottom-centre of the screen and just said something like "can't verify face" while I was trying to delete the malfunctioning face data.
After that, I did a complete factory reset, and when it came back around to the Face Unlock setup section, I got this:

"Enrolment was not completed.
Face enrolment didn't work."
A screenshot as taken from my Pixel 2

It just popped up that error straight away and didn't even bother trying to go through the setup again.
So now I don't know what to do next. Does anyone have any suggestions? Thanks in advance!
